curam.util.common.message

Class FallbackCatalogMessageLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.message.FallbackCatalogMessageLocalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageLocalizer, java.io.Serializable

    public class FallbackCatalogMessageLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageLocalizer, java.io.Serializable
    A message localizer providing safe, internationalized access to message catalog files (properties files) with the ability to fall back to a secondary catalog if a property is not found in the primary catalog, or if the primary catalog is not found.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • FallbackCatalogMessageLocalizer

        public FallbackCatalogMessageLocalizer(java.lang.String primaryCatalogName,
                                       java.lang.String secondaryCatalogName,
                                       java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)

        Create a new catalog-based message localizer. When localizing a message, the primary catalog will be checked first for the the message. If the message is not found, the secondary catalog will then be used instead. Typically, the primary catalog should contain custom messages, messages intended to override the default messages; the secondary catalog should contain the default messages.

        When loading a catalog, the given class loader will be used to locate the catalog on the classpath. This in useful when this class is loaded by a class loader that is an ancestor of the class loader to which the catalog is visible. With no ability to specify a class loader, that catalog would not be found. For example, it is possible to have a J2EE application where the web application WAR file contains the catalog and this message localizer class is present on the classpath of the EAR file containing the WAR file. Typically, the class loader configuration for that deployment would mean that "EAR class loader" could not see any classes or catalogs available to the "WAR class loader". Therefore, the code in the web application should initialize this message localizer with its own class loader. The parent-first delegation mechanism still applies, so this cannot be used to override catalogs with the same name on the parent class loader.

        Parameters:
        primaryCatalogName - The name of the primary message catalog.
        secondaryCatalogName - The name of the secondary message catalog.
        classLoader - The class loader to use to locate the message catalogs. If null, the class loader of this class will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • localizeMessage

        public LocalizedMessage localizeMessage(Message message,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
                                 throws MessageException
        Localizes a message.
